alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 11:34PM EDT until May 20 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dubois County in south central Indiana... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1133 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Jasper to 9 miles northwest of Dale to near Folsomville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jasper, Huntingburg, Ferdinand, Holland, Birdseye, Dubois, Hillham, Celestine, Millersport, and Bretzville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
